alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 10:22PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, western and central Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain moving through areas that received 3/4 to 1 1/2 inches of rain earlier today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will likely experience minor flooding include... Islip, Brentwood, Centereach, Lindenhurst, Medford, Hauppauge, Ronkonkoma, Stony Brook, Babylon, Patchogue, Middle Island, Port Jefferson, Wading River, Robert Moses State Park, Coram, Holbrook, Smithtown, Bay Shore, Sayville and Farmingville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
